note_text:
Pt: Harrison, William || MRN: 782341 || DOB: 03/15/1961
Date: 11/18/2025 || Location: Emory University Hospital, Atlanta, GA
MD: Dr. Rebecca Chen

Dx: RUL endobronchial mass seen on CT, suspected lung cancer
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy

Under moderate sedation (midazolam 4mg, fentanyl 100mcg IV), flexible bronchoscopy performed via oral route with 6.0mm Olympus scope. Airways inspected systematically. Exophytic polypoid mass identified at RB1 orifice, near-completely occluding the segment. Pink-red, friable appearance. 4 endobronchial biopsies obtained with cold forceps. Moderate bleeding controlled with cold saline irrigation. Bronchial washings sent. No other airway abnormalities. Patient tolerated procedure well.

Post-procedure: Stable, SpO2 96% on 2L NC. D/C home with path f/u in 5 days.

R. Chen, MD

clinical_context.primary_indication: RUL endobronchial mass, suspected lung cancer
clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT chest showing RUL endobronchial mass with partial RB1 obstruction

code_rationales.31625: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy of visible RB1 mass. Multiple biopsies at single endobronchial site reported once per CPT guidelines.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Single CPT 31625 appropriate for endobronchial biopsies of visible airway mass.

note_text:
Pt: Martinez, Sofia || MRN: 493827 || DOB: 07/22/1975
Date: 11/20/2025 || Location: UCLA Medical Center, Los Angeles, CA
MD: Dr. Michael Thornton

Dx: Bilateral hilar adenopathy, suspected sarcoidosis
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy, BAL

Moderate sedation achieved. Olympus BF-P190 scope advanced. Diffuse mucosal nodularity and cobblestoning noted at main carina, bilateral mainstem bronchi. Classic sarcoid appearance. 6 endobronchial biopsies taken (3 carina, 2 RMS, 1 LMS). Minimal bleeding. BAL performed at RML (100mL instilled, 55mL returned, clear). No endobronchial obstruction. Procedure uneventful.

Plan: Await pathology for non-caseating granulomas. PFTs if confirmed. F/U pulm clinic 2 weeks.

M. Thornton, MD

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT showing bilateral hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsies of visible mucosal abnormalities at carina and bilateral mainstem bronchi.
code_rationales.31624: BAL performed at RML, separately reportable from endobronchial biopsy.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Appropriate coding for endobronchial biopsy plus BAL in separate lobe.

note_text:
Pt: Thompson, Marcus || MRN: 651294 || DOB: 11/03/1958
Date: 11/22/2025 || Location: Johns Hopkins Hospital, Baltimore, MD
MD: Dr. Amanda Williams, Fellow: Dr. James Park (PGY-5)

Dx: LLL endobronchial lesion, known NSCLC s/p chemo, ? recurrence
Procedure: Flex bronch with endobronchial biopsy

General anesthesia via LMA. Olympus therapeutic scope used. Prior radiation changes noted at LUL. New polypoid lesion at LB6 origin, 50% obstruction. Appears necrotic with surface ulceration. 5 endobronchial biopsies obtained. APC applied (40W, 0.8L/min) for hemostasis after moderate bleeding. Airways otherwise patent. Scope withdrawn, LMA removed, patient extubated.

Stable in PACU. CXR post-procedure unremarkable. D/C to home. Oncology f/u with results.

A. Williams, MD / J. Park, MD

clinical_context.primary_indication: LLL endobronchial lesion, known NSCLC post-chemo, suspected recurrence

endobronchial_biopsy.lesion_appearance: Polypoid, necrotic with surface ulceration, 50% obstruction

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy of LB6 lesion. APC used for hemostasis only (not tumor destruction), so 31641 not appropriate. Hemostasis is bundled into biopsy code.

cpt_summary.coding_notes: APC for bleeding control after biopsy is not separately billable.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Single code for endobronchial biopsy; APC hemostasis bundled.

note_text:
Pt: O'Brien, Kathleen || MRN: 829174 || DOB: 05/18/1969
Date: 11/25/2025 || Location: Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, OH
MD: Dr. David Kim

Dx: Recurrent hemoptysis, RML bronchial lesion on CT
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy

Moderate sedation. Bronchoscopy via nasal approach with 4.9mm scope. Blood-tinged secretions in RML. Sessile raised lesion at RB4 with overlying clot. Clot gently removed with suction. Underlying 8mm reddish lesion visualized. 3 biopsies taken with small cup forceps. Brisk bleeding controlled with ice saline and topical epinephrine (1:10,000). No active bleeding at end. Remainder of airways normal.

Post-procedure stable. No further hemoptysis. F/U path in 1 week. Return precautions given.

D. Kim, MD

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT showing RML bronchial wall thickening

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy of visible RB4 lesion in patient with hemoptysis.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Standard endobronchial biopsy code for hemoptysis workup.

note_text:
Pt: Nguyen, Tran || MRN: 374618 || DOB: 02/28/1982
Date: 11/28/2025 || Location: UCSF Medical Center, San Francisco, CA
MD: Dr. Elizabeth Foster

Dx: HIV+ (CD4 120), multiple pulmonary Kaposi sarcoma lesions
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy, bronchial wash

Moderate sedation with propofol infusion. Standard bronchoscopy. Multiple violaceous raised plaques noted: 2 in trachea, 3 in RMS, 2 in LMS, consistent with endobronchial KS. Representative biopsies taken from RMS (2) and LMS (2) lesions. Minimal bleeding. Bronchial wash from LLL for PCP rule-out.

Patient stable. ID and oncology aware. D/C with close outpatient f/u. ART optimization planned.

E. Foster, MD

clinical_context.primary_indication: HIV+ with multiple pulmonary Kaposi sarcoma lesions
clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT showing multiple pulmonary nodules and bronchial wall irregularities

endobronchial_biopsy.lesion_appearance: Multiple violaceous raised plaques, consistent with Kaposi sarcoma

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsies of Kaposi sarcoma lesions in bilateral mainstem bronchi.
code_rationales.31622: Bronchial wash from LLL for PCP workup, separately reportable.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Appropriate coding for endobronchial biopsy of KS lesions plus diagnostic wash.

note_text:
Pt: Davis, Robert || MRN: 582736 || DOB: 08/14/1955
Date: 12/01/2025 || Location: Duke University Hospital, Durham, NC
MD: Dr. Sarah Mitchell, Fellow: Dr. Kevin Lee (PGY-6)

Dx: Tracheal mass, stridor
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy

General anesthesia, jet ventilation. Rigid bronchoscope (Karl Storz 12mm) inserted. Large pedunculated mass arising from posterior trachea, 2cm above carina, causing 70% obstruction. Mobile, well-vascularized. 4 biopsies with rigid cup forceps. Moderate bleeding - controlled with suction and pressure. Decision to await pathology before debulking. Scope exchanged for ETT, patient ventilated and transferred to PACU intubated for airway monitoring.

Admit to stepdown. Repeat bronch for potential debulking pending path.

S. Mitchell, MD / K. Lee, MD

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT showing tracheal mass 2cm above carina

follow_up_plan: Repeat bronchoscopy for potential debulking pending pathology

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy of tracheal mass via rigid bronchoscopy. No debulking performed this session. 31625 covers bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy regardless of rigid vs flexible approach.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Biopsy only without therapeutic intervention; single code appropriate.

note_text:
Pt: Anderson, Linda || MRN: 419283 || DOB: 12/07/1970
Date: 12/03/2025 || Location: Northwestern Memorial Hospital, Chicago, IL
MD: Dr. Richard Patel

Dx: RUL mass with endobronchial extension seen on PET (SUV 12.4)
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy, brushings

Moderate sedation. Oral bronchoscopy. RUL apical segment (RB1) shows extrinsic compression with mucosal invasion - erythematous, irregular mucosa extending into lumen. 5 endobronchial biopsies obtained. Protected brush specimen from same site. LUL, LLL, RML, RLL all normal. No secretions or blood.

ROSE: Atypical cells, suspicious for malignancy.

D/C home. Path results to be discussed at tumor board. PET staging complete.

R. Patel, MD

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: PET-CT showing RUL mass SUV 12.4 with endobronchial component

endobronchial_biopsy.lesion_appearance: Erythematous, irregular mucosa with luminal invasion

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy of RB1 lesion with visible mucosal abnormality.
code_rationales.31623: Protected brushing at same site, separately reportable per CPT guidelines.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Appropriate coding for combined biopsy and protected brushing.

note_text:
Pt: Wilson, James || MRN: 736492 || DOB: 04/25/1963
Date: 12/05/2025 || Location: Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN
MD: Dr. Catherine Moore

Dx: Post-lung transplant, new endobronchial lesions at anastomosis
Procedure: Surveillance bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy, TBBx

General anesthesia via ETT. Bilateral lung transplant 18 months ago. RMS anastomosis with granulation tissue and 2 small polyps. LMS anastomosis with single granuloma. Endobronchial biopsies: 2 from RMS, 1 from LMS. TBBx from RLL (4 specimens) and LLL (4 specimens) for rejection surveillance. BAL from RML. Minimal bleeding throughout.

Path pending. Continue current immunosuppression. F/U transplant clinic.

C. Moore, MD

clinical_context.primary_indication: Post-lung transplant surveillance, new endobronchial lesions at anastomosis

endobronchial_biopsy.lesion_appearance: Granulation tissue, small polyps (RMS); single granuloma (LMS)

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsies of anastomotic lesions (granulation tissue, polyps, granuloma).
code_rationales.31632: Add-on code for transbronchial biopsy of additional lobe (LLL).

coding_review.overall_assessment: Complex transplant surveillance with endobronchial biopsy, bilateral TBBx, and BAL appropriately coded.

note_text:
Pt: Garcia, Maria || MRN: 284719 || DOB: 09/30/1978
Date: 12/06/2025 || Location: UT Southwestern, Dallas, TX
MD: Dr. Thomas Green, Fellow: Dr. Amy Zhao (PGY-5)

Dx: Chronic cough, CT shows RML bronchial narrowing with thickening
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy

Moderate sedation. Flexible bronchoscopy. RML orifice shows circumferential mucosal thickening with narrowing to ~5mm. No exophytic mass. Mucosa appears edematous and erythematous. 4 biopsies obtained circumferentially. Appearance concerning for possible carcinoid or inflammatory stricture. Airways otherwise unremarkable. No complications.

D/C with return precautions. Path f/u next week.

T. Green, MD / A. Zhao, MD

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT showing RML bronchial narrowing with wall thickening

endobronchial_biopsy.lesion_appearance: Circumferential mucosal thickening, edematous and erythematous, narrowing to 5mm

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsy of visible mucosal abnormality at RML orifice causing stricture.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Standard endobronchial biopsy for bronchial stricture evaluation.

note_text:
Pt: Brown, Charles || MRN: 927364 || DOB: 01/11/1950
Date: 12/08/2025 || Location: Stanford Health Care, Palo Alto, CA
MD: Dr. Jennifer Wu

Dx: Metastatic melanoma, new cough, CT with multiple endobronchial nodules
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy

General anesthesia via LMA for airway protection given bulky disease. Multiple pigmented nodular lesions seen: 3 in trachea, 4 in RMS, 2 in LMS, 2 in BI, consistent with metastatic melanoma. Representative biopsies from trachea (2), RMS (2), LMS (1). Dark pigmented tissue obtained. Minimal bleeding. Airways remain patent despite diffuse disease.

Medical oncology consulted. Immunotherapy to be considered. Palliative care referral. D/C home.

J. Wu, MD

clinical_context.primary_indication: Metastatic melanoma with new cough and multiple endobronchial nodules
clinical_context.radiographic_findings: CT showing multiple endobronchial nodules throughout central airways

endobronchial_biopsy.lesion_appearance: Multiple pigmented nodular lesions, consistent with metastatic melanoma

code_rationales.31625: Endobronchial biopsies of visible metastatic melanoma lesions at multiple sites. Per CPT, 31625 is reported once per session regardless of number of biopsy sites.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Single endobronchial biopsy code for metastatic disease confirmation.
